website_summaries.verdict: The Asus VG248QE is a 24-inch gaming monitor featuring a 144Hz refresh rate, a speedy pixel response, and a highly adjustable stand. It's a good performer but could use a few more gamer-centric features.

customer_reviews.title: Buy at your own risk.
customer_reviews.text: Granted the colours we're good, and it was well designed. The monitor was faulty. Horrible ghosting, flickering and horizontal lines. Tried both HDMI and DVI different cables. Requested a replacement, instead was only offered a refund. Which is a hassle. My guess is because this is a reoccurring problem. Buy at your own risk. If you get a good model great, but I feel you should be prepared to return it.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Used to be a great monitor
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this monitor to sit beside the VG248QE I purchased 5 years ago. Much to my surprise, the new one has a strong yellow tint.. I reset the settings on both of the identical monitors, changed cables, calibrated etc.. Nothing can hide the dirty yellow colour on the new monitor. I'm contacting ASUS support at the moment but may have to claim a refund and choose another brand because I see another reviewer described the exact same issue..
customer_reviews.author: J B

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this monitor because i wanted a bigger screen and to try out the 144hz and boy does it make a difference! It felt like going from 30fps to 60 fps for the first time again and even more, I was surprised! Before receiving the monitor i was all worried about the reviews because i saw other people who got the IPS version in 27 inch complain of dead pixels but i don't have any so i'm thrilled, There's no flickering or anything either the monitor all works perfectly i'm overall extremely happy with the purchase, You do have to change a few settings to get the right image for you but it's fairly easy stuff
customer_reviews.author: Aruxa

customer_reviews.title: Update: Pay over £400 quid for these stupid gaming monitors and you still get 3-4 stuck pixels!?
customer_reviews.text: This is disrespectful to customers. So they charge over £400 for this garbage quality control so that my monitor has 3-4 stuck pixels? I.e. they're stuck on red or green? I paid £100 5 years ago for some cheapy 24" IPS panel and it never gave me this problem at all, so why does ASUS think it's okay to charge over £400 and not even get their blooming quality control in check? What is this garbage! Returning this piece of cr*p. ASUS need to do better in order to justify charging so much. Don't give a monkeys about high refresh rates and all other rubbish if you can't even get something so basic right!
customer_reviews.author: GrumpyGit

customer_reviews.title: 144Hrz - Bliss
customer_reviews.text: I've two of these & I'll most likely purchase a third. Adjusting the hight, tilt & rotation is absolutely fantastic - smooth & solid, I cannot praise that aspect enough. The colour is fine for me & I love 144Hrz for gaming as some games tend to make me feel sick {Talso Principle and such} but at 144Hrz it's smooth as silk. Coupled with 1ms response time, ensures quality peace of mind gaming. Well constructed & easy to assemble. Zero dead pixels. Price is a tad high IMO.
customer_reviews.author: Feedback for you. Ya you.

customer_reviews.title: Very poor build quality
customer_reviews.text: So bought this following all the great reviews. Arrived plugged in and hold on what's that... Is either a misalignment in the screen or the bezel if moulded incorrectly. Either way allowing the backlight to escape at the side. Asus come on this is what I would expect for a cheap knock-off not am Asus branded product. Amazon to the rescue are sending a replacement as soon as possible. If that is not right I will request a refund and return to Samsung. Shame as I was looking forward to this monitor delivering as per all the reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great screen
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic screen, set it up to 120Hz and Full HD, works fine and causing much less eye strain than my previous screen. I also like the adjustment options, it goes up/ down; rotates landscape/ portrait and also rotates on its leg so you can change the position without moving it's base. The downside was that it came with 2 power cables, the UK and European plugs respectively, however the cable with the UK plug was not compatible with the connection port on the back of the screen (ain't it crazy huh?!). So I had to order an extra adapter for the European plug cable to fit the UK socket.
customer_reviews.author: M.A.

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality for price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this monitor after a few reviews from other customer and was unsure of the purchase. The build quality is decent however problems start when you turn the screen on, for an ips panel, the darks on this screen are very poor. I actually found my old acer gn24 had a better overall image quality and thats a £130 monitor. I had a couple of dead pixels on the display which is fine, but screen flickering is not something I will put up with. In all honesty I would not recommend this monitor at all, even if it was working fine the disappointment in the image quality would have been enough to return it.
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: The Game Changer !
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant for what I need it for. I am using it for PS4 Pro and it has completely changed my gaming experience for the better. I have previously played on 50-65 inch TVs what a difference this monitor has made. Colours and clarity are amazing which was my main reason for the purchase. Also it gives you the option of several built in settings such as, Racing, FPS , RPG and cinema. Very good product and I couldn't be happier,well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: griff

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable quaility
customer_reviews.text: When I first got the monitor I really hated it. But after a lot of adjustments it worked perfect nice and clear did try a few games on it they worked well . The colours seem really vibrant on this monitor . It has DVI/RGB and HDMI connections. There is also a sound jack connection. But on the whole I would say it's not a bad monitor . Black and shiny case shows up fingerprints. Comes in a big box and very well packed.
customer_reviews.author: Paul.C

customer_reviews.title: Just don't unless you're in games 24/7.. Even then I wouldn't.
customer_reviews.text: VG259Q came with a bunch of dead pixels out of the box. Looking at desktop or just browsing made my eyes hurt, picture was so bad, I don't know why is this even IPS. Colors were bland and letters blurry/unclear on all screen preset modes, perhaps only scenery was bearable but the contrast was hurting. In games this was not that noticeable unless there was any text or chat involved. This whole thing is embarrassing for Asus, its my first screen from them and impression is bad. Don't let me start about the lack of cable management or USB ports.. Five stars for design, it does look neat, I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Pager

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality and dead pixels
customer_reviews.text: Honestly a very very poor experience as I had two of this monitors and the first on developed a dead pixel and I asked for a replacement which they agreed upon and keep in mind the second time I used the original monitor I noticed it had developed the dead pixel of course so once the replacement arrived I took it fresh out of the box and hooked it up and lo and behold it had a dead pixel so I have asked for a full refund for the monitor really wouldn't recommend buying it honestly spend the money on something else just not this 280hz version
customer_reviews.author: sonny

customer_reviews.title: This is a must have for any form of computing!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was unsure what monitor to get for my new pc and this turned out to be the best choice for me. The screen size is brilliant, the quality is bright and vibrant colour. The screen rotation helps for writing word documents and other forms of media. The height adjustment works perfectly and I have had no issues. The only downside which is expected would be the speaker quality, however not bad, but really quiet. But a good pair of headphones or speakers will fix this.
customer_reviews.author: UndeadManslay3r

customer_reviews.title: Lovely looking monitor with great picture quality.
customer_reviews.text: Lovely monitor but had to return two of them due to bad backlight bleed. The first had terrible bleed especially in the lower left corner that showed even on bright scenes. The 2nd I'm having to return as it has terrible bleed but in 3 corners which is so off putting. Such a shame as it's a lovely looking monitor and has beautiful colours but the backlight bleed lets it down. Edit: Decided to keep the second Monitor as overnight the backlight bleed got a lot better, most of it went which was surprising. So will up my star rating as like i said it's a lovely looking monitor with great picture quality.
customer_reviews.author: J. Seymour

customer_reviews.title: Impressive!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace my 22inch 1080p tv for Xbox and in preparation for the new (PS5/Xbox Series X) and I'm impressed! Build quality is superb, the visuals are sharp and bright, tonnes of modes and adjustability. Needs some fine tuning in the settings to get it how you want it but after that its superb for gaming/Netlfix/YouTube. Think some additional RGB light strips would really lift the viewing experience which I'm thinking about l
customer_reviews.author: Hassan

customer_reviews.title: Far better options available.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Very good quality stand with versatility Colours are vibrant Perfect size for gaming Cons: HDR performance is terrible Sharpness levels are too low even with the sharpness setting on max Volume is broken, volume on 1 is the same as 100 for some reason, there is no in between No hot keys for the buttons on the side, have to go through multiple menus to adjust sound and brightness etc Overall, not worth the money and was very disappointing
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super sharp, super fast, super sleek
customer_reviews.text: Nicely packaged easy to set up physicaly and through the easy to use menu on the monitor for all the special features, elmb sync is insane and makes everything super clear when playing fast paced games, colours are accurate and vivid, monitor is bright enough to play in a conservatory with windows all around on an averagly sunny day, however struggles when playing dark games but would be fine in a normal room. The stand is brilliant and hugely flexible on how you want your monitor positioned, no dead pixels and love the in built OC to 165hz from 144hz
customer_reviews.author: Sophie Jade

customer_reviews.title: Smooth and crisp imaging
customer_reviews.text: I've had my VG248QE 144hz/1080/1ms TN monitor now for a couple of years. I have to say that this screen is top notch and now for around the £200 mark makes its fantastic value for a gaming focused monitor. My only tiny gripe is, occasionally (its happened to me 3 times in over 2 years) it will give a display port error, in which case you un-plug the power cable, plug it back in and its sorted. (its a known fault). Other than that perfect. Great monitor. Silky smooth display, crisp image.
customer_reviews.author: DangerNoodle

customer_reviews.title: Expensive Good Monitor with Crappy HDMI cable
customer_reviews.text: In short monitor is good all round but to unlock 144Hz advertised refresh rate you actually need to buy a good Display Port cable that is about £9. Why is the one of best in category very expensive monitor gives the useless HDMI cable... you shouldn't even buy THIS MONITOR if you you have HDMI only port. TLDR; Goo Expensive monitor, to use it you have to buy Display Port as without it it's pointless purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Dainius

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor, especially for its price.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I've bought this monitor, as previously I had to sell my PC and peripherals for personal reasons. It's a great product, and considering it's regularly on sale for £170 or so, you can't go wrong. If it's your first 144Hz monitor, you're in for a ride. Just make sure you're using displayport or the included DVI cable, and you enable 144Hz in Windows' display settings.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Jones

customer_reviews.title: Horrible ghosting, weird colors
customer_reviews.text: I've bought this monitor mainly for software development, not so much for games. At 60Hz there are literally trails when you scroll your code. It becomes usable only at 144Hz. The image, that supposed to be good, since it's IPS, is either too sharp or too blurry. I own another monitor which is VA, supposed to be worse at color representation, but it's actually much better. Keeping this monitor mainly because it's too much hassle sending it back. The good: it actually works, no dead pixels The bad: everything else
customer_reviews.author: Felis Catus

customer_reviews.title: 165Hz only when overclocked
customer_reviews.text: Loved the colours, very small back light bleed around edges. Top 165Hz downwards refresh rate only when Overclocking otherwise without overclocking a choice of 144Hz,120Hz,100Hz and 60Hz. So not quite what it said on the original advert. Gsync compatible kicks in when at 48 frames per second and above. True Gsync kicks in at zero onwards. Compatible does however allow you to have a none Nvidia graphics card providing you have a display port. All in all though not a bad monitor I just don't like to overclock things, tends to wear them out quicker.
customer_reviews.author: Kando

customer_reviews.title: pretty nice
customer_reviews.text: the monitor does well for the price, arrived a few days before predicted, picture quality in a dark room is good but as soon as the sun catches it the colouring becomes a bit washy. I solved this by living my life in the dark so its no longer a problem. lots of ports and customisation both physical and brightness/colours i wish i could make the brightness a lil dark to match my room but meh it does its job well
customer_reviews.author: william

customer_reviews.title: VERY disappointing picture quality
customer_reviews.text: The monitor looks alright aesthetically, and works fine, 144hz is a huge step up from 60. But immediately on startup you can't help but feel disappointed with the picture quality. The colours are all washed out, even after messing around in the image settings there isn't much improvement. Darker colours you might as well forget about entirely, the monitor has about 5 shades of black that sit next to eachother like massive pixellated blobs. Really horrible. Honestly, wish I'd spent more on something better quality, a monitor isn't something you should be cheaping out on. I mean, if you can call £200 'cheap'.
customer_reviews.author: Joe T

customer_reviews.title: Excellent display, some connection issues, otherwise perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Great monitor, the refresh rate is an awesome experience if you're used to 60hz, and whenever I go back to 60hz the difference is the most notable. I've had a few issues with firmware and connectivity, every now and again it won't display anything and the only fix is to remove the power supply for 15-20 seconds until it completely powers down. The stand can get scratched very easily which can make your battlestation look a bit cheap, but the display itself has excellent colours and viewing angles, a great display overall. The inbuilt speaker is also pretty high quality.
customer_reviews.author: User

customer_reviews.title: Poor picture quality and backlight bleed.
customer_reviews.text: This is supposed to be a good entry level IPS Monitor, but it does not perform well at all. It has horrible backlight bleed that is noticeable on all colours, but particularly darker colours (such as black as shown in the photo attached). I was severely disappointed in both the OSD options menu for lack of flexibility, in the colour quality and brightness. As soon as contrast is turned too high, severe backlight bleed is noticeable - and black is just poorer quality than expected even on an IPS panel. Go for the equivalent TN or VA panel price range and you'll be more satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Simon

customer_reviews.title: Great Monitor!
customer_reviews.text: replaces my old cheapo 24" Benq TN panel with the 24.5" asus model . very happy with the quality! not had any of the issues some people stated about blurriness etc. Note: you will need to do some minor calibration tweaks as I found mine was way too bright with too much contrast by default but the OSD is very easy to use so no biggy.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Very very good monitor
customer_reviews.text: This is a very very good monitor. It has an outstanding IPS panel with very good factory calibration! The 144hz refreshh rate is a treat and the overdrive modes are nice withh no overshoot too! The monitor has freesync which can also be used withh ELMB. Sadly overdrive cannot be usedd or tweaked while ELMB is on. This monitor has nice touches like the cheat crosshairs, FPS counters, Timers and more! Thhe monitors stand may be plastic be it does off height adjust, tilt, pivot and can be turned portrait if needed. If this monitor is out of your price range i casn highly recommend thhe AOC 24G2U or 27G2U.
customer_reviews.author: CiaranGou

customer_reviews.title: Avoid at all costs.
customer_reviews.text: While highly rated (for 2013), this panel is atrocious. * The flicker is strikingly apparent; this is the only monitor I have ever used that has induced eye strain. * Colours are wholly inaccurate. Nothing will fix this (not even the Nvidia digital illumination trick.) 144 Hz is nice, if you want to step up the responsiveness of your desktop and gaming. But this monitor is a no-go. Get a more recent, flicker-free monitor and thank me later.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Still worth it in today's standards
customer_reviews.text: Bmno word ofnanlie this is a good monitor for what it is now days yes their is a hp with gysync compat but this also does all the rangers up to 144hz yes I can see the difference between the two.. easy way to show this is take a TV and this screen and plug both in 1 onn144. And other on 60 and that's what Adavantge you get by using the right equipment most TVs come with game mode that reduces input lag but after using this screen I can't see how people game on any but these kind of screens ..
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: DDAAAaaaUUUuuuummm!
customer_reviews.text: Holy moly this monitor is sexy. I was worried it might be a little big coming from previously owning a 24" monitor but this is puuuurrrfect. Gaming is sooo smooth now.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. S. Lutton

customer_reviews.title: Simply Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as it was recommended by a friend whom is a top tier CSGO player. This is my first 144Hz monito and holy hell the difference is phenomenal! It's so much smoother in and game you play at 144Hz, I can't believe I've used a 60Hz monitor for so long when this technology has been around for years now. The only thing I'd say is that the stock colour profile is really dull so either tinker around with the stock colour settings or download an icc colour profile and job done 10/10.1
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Barker

customer_reviews.title: Great picture, great price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my bro, but tested it myself before giving him it. I have cheapo AOC monitors and this was night and day better when it came to picture quality and sharpness. I really like ASUS as a brand, they make great products with a decent price.
customer_reviews.author: Slug

customer_reviews.title: IPS glow
customer_reviews.text: Nice monitor, looks great, good image quality. Colours aren't very accurate though. Problem is the awful IPS glow in the corners. Made watching anything with dark scenes terrible. Refunded.
customer_reviews.author: MitG

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as I would have liked :(
customer_reviews.text: After a month of purchasing this monitor it started to make a loud humming noise and flickering white lines appeared in certain games. Amazon will not allow me to return as I’ve had it over a months and the asus return policy is slow and gives me little confidence this will be dealt with.
customer_reviews.author: Kam

customer_reviews.title: Great screen
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this to go along with my existing ASUS screen that was missing DP input (graphics card only has 1 HDMI out). Great screen and crystal clear. I use it for streaming everything from Elite Dangerous to Battlefield and have never had an issue with ASUS in general would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: John Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Avoid this product or you will regret it.
customer_reviews.text: How exactly can I get two seperate monitors and both have faults? Both have a low buzzing noises when ELMB and g sync are enabled which is why I returned my first one now my second monitor has the same issue but with dead pixels. ASUS are a total joke, avoid this product.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Pollock

customer_reviews.title: 144Hz gaming monitor
customer_reviews.text: brought this to replace my older viewsonic gaming monitor this works really well has a display port but does not come with a DP cable so if you want for DP then you will need to buy a cable if you don't already have one it is a bright monitor but there is calibration settings available on the internet for this monitor which does make it a lot better for viewing and it is also a 144Hz monitor too so if you have a good graphics card and can get good FPS then with it being 144Hz it looks very smooth
customer_reviews.author: Pixela1311

customer_reviews.title: Great Monitor
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my grandson who is well into his gaming. He says that the quality of the picture is far better than the HDTV he was used to using.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Nevard

customer_reviews.title: Simply Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Impressed this product is amazing for the price I paid, however there is one issue with this monitor and the Supposed colour white has an orange tint. This isn’t related to calibration or colour settings as I’ve tried every possibility and the orange tint is incredibly visible when compared to my Acer Monitor. If you can get over the orange tint than for a 144hz monitor it’s alright for FPS gaming. Wish this monitor had a clear white however it doesn’t.
customer_reviews.author: Nizar Jaff

customer_reviews.title: Great budget / entry level monitor
customer_reviews.text: Had this monitor for 3 years it's been fantastic about to upgrade to a 2k monitor by Asus now and figured I'd give this one the praise it deserves being a 144hz monitor means so long as your machine can run it you can actulay get up to 144 frames per second which honestly makes more of a diffrence than 2k at 60fps dose it's a great budget / entry level monitor that doesn't disappoint and with the eye comfort mode and other modes means that regardless of what your using it for at the touch of a button you can get the colours to pop right
customer_reviews.author: Shauni Donachie

customer_reviews.title: Good screen bright clear and good color
customer_reviews.text: Nice as a screen fast and clear with good detail. not got much to compare it with but im happy with it. Other comments about speakers are accurate, i dont use them at all, even though the HDMI connection sometimes gives it priority. They are in the back near the stand so sound muffled and quiet. Also you can only turn the screen to landscape at the top of its height travel.
customer_reviews.author: Chris R

customer_reviews.title: Goooood
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely fantastic. I am running it on 240hz and it’s stunning. For gaming I would say it’s good investment as we already have graphic cards supporting 300+fps. I tried it for two hours playing Warzone and changing from 60 to 140fps is a massive difference. Build quality is really good, and you can adjust the high and angle also rotate it and use it portray mode. Really good monitor.
customer_reviews.author: frezee

customer_reviews.title: Dead Pixel
customer_reviews.text: After reading all the reviews about this monitor having dead pixels upon arrival I decided to buy one as it was decently priced, guess what, it had a dead pixel. The picture quality was fine and it was quite hefty, not always a good thing but it tells me it it built fairly well. But, in the end it was returned as it was faulty, seems to be a fairly common issue too.
customer_reviews.author: Conor Tomlin

customer_reviews.title: 280HZ.. Enough said!
customer_reviews.text: I've only had a few hours to play with this monitor so far. I've just changed from a 1440p144hz 27" monitor to this beauty, the graphics still look great on 1080p, and my god, 144hz to 280hz is definitely noticable. I wouldn't say the jump is as crazy as 60hz to 144hz, however, I can definitely feel this refresh rate, it's incredible how nice and smooth my games are! I can see through space and time, my opponents don't stand a chance. :)
customer_reviews.author: Jim Davies

customer_reviews.title: The best screen ever I’m told!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one we have bought,, they are now next to one another. Our son loves gaming and has school work to do! These screens turn so he says they’re great for programming the screen quality is really good, fantastic graphics so I’m told.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Not supplied with British plug or suitable means of providing power.
customer_reviews.text: Came with EU plug and although British plug included the other end of the plug did not fit on onboard plug. Amazon offloads to Asus, who only operate 9-5 and being a B/H weekend. E-mail sent. Unable to find anyway to contact amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Maverick

customer_reviews.title: Great Screen
customer_reviews.text: Now this is a screen! Awesome response time, crisp clear colour quality. Compared to ASUS other models, the colour quality and the response time is what you pay for. This screen can also be customised to any height, tilt and rotation you want, you don't get this on most monitors. The height adjustment is too loose, any slight pressure or weight applied will cause the screen to instantly drop, so mounting anything on top of the screen is a no go. You might get away with a webcam, but you cannot mount a kinnect if your an Xbox player. Overall I am chuffed to bits though.
customer_reviews.author: Leighton Bellamore

customer_reviews.title: This monitor is old and outdated with horrible muddy whites
customer_reviews.text: It's not a horrible monitor, it has nice 144hz performance but there is no reason to buy one when there are better more recent options available at the same price point. The screen has terrible banding issues which are very noticeable. I just returned mine after being deceived by the good reviews. Make sure to read up from multiple sources about the monitor you're intending to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jozef

customer_reviews.title: Display issues!
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is great... when it works! I have 2 of these monitors connected to my desktop PC and it is always a gamble when I turn it on. I never know if I am going to see my desktop, or a "displayport no signal" error. This issue happens with both monitors and I have tried all the troubleshooting tips, all cables are securely connected and even turning everything off and on again does nothing to fix the issue. Sadly I can no longer get a refund so I am stuck with two monitors that just *might* work now and then. I'd strongly suggest looking elsewhere for a monitor as this product has caused me far too many issues.
customer_reviews.author: Beaverfever

customer_reviews.title: I've felt the difference immediatly, it feels like cheating in twitch shooters
customer_reviews.text: Going from 60Hz to this feels amazing, scrolling trough code or lots of text like Excel and Word just feels better instantly. Picture quality is good, but I recommend finding what suits you best, Gaming wise this is the way to play games in multiplayer. Fast AF, no blur and snap snappity responsiveness Make sure to change your display settings to 1920x1080p@144Hz when you install it Look for Amazon Warehouse deals as I got mine for 125£
customer_reviews.author: Cezar

customer_reviews.title: Quality product. Arrived before time, perfectly packaged.
customer_reviews.text: This is just an amazing monitor. No problem in the assembly, the bracket is just so versatile. Up down rotate tilt, all with plenty of scope. This really is a great product. The picture quality is amazing, Destiny 2 in HDR is a beautiful sight. Brings the game to life and adds another dimension to gameplay for me. I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Hannafin

customer_reviews.title: An excellent gaming monitor
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a Christmas present for my 15 year-old grandson. He uses it mainly for playing games and absolutely loves it! Screen movement is really smooth. There seems to be no chance of him letting his old grandad have a go. Can't fault it.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce65

customer_reviews.title: Very good monitor.
customer_reviews.text: Very clear quality good monitor can movethe screen vertical if u want to use it as a wnd chat monitor. Sound isnt the best however and not very loud i dont use it but just incase u dont have headphones.
customer_reviews.author: ruidego

customer_reviews.title: No display port cable
customer_reviews.text: Does not include display port cable. You need to buy it separately. There is no information about it in discription. If I'm buying 144hz screen I want it to come with everything that I need, good that someone told me what was the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Ely

customer_reviews.title: Great Alternative to the VG249Q
customer_reviews.text: ASUS VG27AQ excellent Monitor for the price Colours are sharp and clear Full of extra features (still exploring them) as replacing an old 19" monitor from 2004 G-Sync compatibility which is a plus for me comes with a Display port cable so no need to purchase one (does not come with a HDMI Cable ) one thing that surprised me is the power lead it comes with an adaptor which goes to a small laptop type plug , that plugs into the monitor highly recommend this model :)
customer_reviews.author: Ray  Higgins

customer_reviews.title: Very nice monitor, however came with a dead pixel and ...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice monitor, however came with a dead pixel and wasn't very impressed. Thought it would be like every other monitor i've had which had no issues, guess that wasn't the case. This wouldn't typically be a big issue however I game for a long amount of time and I have caught myself looking at the dead pixel very often as it's so distracting. Later I ordered a replacement however this one also had two dead pixels in the bottom right corner, I have seen a lot of reviews on this product where people mention this issue however there were also a few lucky people which didn't, this was the reason I bought it and overlooked the pixel issue.
customer_reviews.author: kamdj

customer_reviews.title: HDR GSync and DP1.2
customer_reviews.text: In overall everything is fine with this monitor. It's great. One issue i did not like. It has DP1.2 version port (it does not support HDR) HDMI port does not support GSync, but support HDR. So you cant use GSync and HDR at same time. Had to return monitor. Looking towards 27GL850 or 27GL83A now.
customer_reviews.author: Arturas Moliusis

customer_reviews.title: Amazing picture quality.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic monitor for anything you do. 27 inches seems the perfect size for my gaming, video watching and work. Picked this one for its g-sync as well. I am running with a 1660 ti, so my differ with other GPU's, don't know.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant 3D gaming monitor
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy stereoscopic 3D blu-ray movies and PC gaming. This monitor delivers! 144 Hz refresh rate is astonishingly clear. Displayport, DVI and HDMI inputs give plenty of connection options. The stand is easily flexible for tilt, height and rotation. You can rotate through 90 degrees for portrait or landscape viewing. 3D content is simply stunning - this monitor is "Nvidia 3D Vision ready" but doesn't have a built-in IR emitter - meaning you also need to have an Nvidia active wireless 3D glasses kit with USB emitter to make the 3D glasses work.
customer_reviews.author: Iain Tricker

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: This monitor has a bunch of nice settings and presets you can configure for movies & gaming, it runs up to 144hz but NOTE : the monitor is NOT delivered with a displayport adaptor.. well mine wasn't atleast, and as HDMI caps at 60hz , don't forget to grab yourself a displayport cable with your shopping :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Very nice monitor that's easily adjustable across different dimensions. Very easy and fast to set up. Quite pleased with the quality considering the price. Overall a great monitor that does the job for a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fast refresh rate is nice, monitor itself isn't
customer_reviews.text: Half the time it defaults to 100hz, making everything look fuzzy, and the only way to sort it is to keep restarting until the option magically appears in the NoVideo control panel. Oh and there's a very annoyingly positioned dead pixel in the middle of the screen after maybe two years of use. Avoid this monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Frodo Baggins

customer_reviews.title: Thin bezels, high performance, super bright. HDR has artifacts though
customer_reviews.text: Its so bright i need to turn the monitor 60% so my eyeballs dont burn when i have a white page on full screen. No major light bleeds. HDR mode has artifacts...
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price!!
customer_reviews.text: A good bang for the buck. As we know it's a TN panel so don't expect a very nice and colour accurate screen. But tweaking the settings will give you a better outcome. All these info can be obtained from the internet so no worries. I used it for CS:GO and movies, turns out it is perfectly fine and it works well being my expectation. As a student this fits my budget very well. If you are really looking for a very good colour accurate monitor look at IPS panel with 144hz and of course be ready to be the extra buck cause it is really ain't cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Yeow Kai Shiun

customer_reviews.title: Non uk plug
customer_reviews.text: Item is sold and fulfilled by amazon. Arrived with a continental plug. Box says destination netherlands. Purchased from amazon.co.uk. Spent literally 70 minutes on live chat to avoid having to do a full return and refund and see if I can get just a replacement power cable. Too much headache to recommend buying this model through amazon.
customer_reviews.author: T M CHO

customer_reviews.title: Refresh rates
customer_reviews.text: Once i got this monitor i was happy as i know that 144hz is healthy for the eyes and that. That was the only reason i wanted to get this. Three months into using this i found out that i am unable to switch to 144 or anything near. The maximum is 60. Tried from both the NVIDIA control panel and the computer settings. The max on both is just 60. I feel like this is illegal as it is false advertisement. Might do something about that.
customer_reviews.author: marinkata

customer_reviews.title: Excellent monitor!
customer_reviews.text: Just built a new gaming PC and I'm so happy with this monitor! Superb picture for both work & gaming, fast response times solid build quality. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant product!
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality and very quick delivery, I got this from amazon warehouse under damaged packaging and it arrived just like new and no problem at all, I play a lot of Counter Strike Global Offensive and this monitor really does give a much better playing experience and response time than my old 32 inch tv that I used to play on! I use this with an asus mx279h that I use for watching films! I would definitely recommend this monitor and 144hz really does give you the edge in fps games!
customer_reviews.author: Oliver G.

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Excellent delivery timing, good size package, good quality for the price. Excellent seller. Whoever wants something like this the best choice to buy, highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Horazon

customer_reviews.title: ASUS VG248QE and Predator X34
customer_reviews.text: This is a great Gaming Monitor and I would recommend this to any Gamer. Despite it being a TN Panel, the Vision Angles and Colours are much better than expected. I use this to play fast action games like Rocket League, Overwatch, CS:GO and most FPS Games. I now own a Predator X34 Gaming Monitor and I use that as my primary monitor now but it costs almost £1000. I recommend this one for the value. The X34 has a 120hz Overclocked Refresh Rate but is an IPS Panel with Wonderful colours and gives a great experience.
customer_reviews.author: Justin G

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Backlight glow. Bottom right was orange. Elmb sync just ruins the picture quality. I ended up returning and keeping my PX7 Prime
customer_reviews.author: Jason Burbery

customer_reviews.title: JUST WOW...
customer_reviews.text: Probably best monitor on market. I can't believe how fast this monitor is. Just buy it, you won't regret. This monitor legit makes your PC faster :) it feels that way xd
customer_reviews.author: B. SERT

customer_reviews.title: Excellent monitor for gaming
customer_reviews.text: Excellent monitor my son uses with his gaming system, great colour. Brightness bought adjustable bracket as well and he loves the flexibility of being able to position his Monitor in different ways
customer_reviews.author: Senga Cadger

customer_reviews.title: Comes with wrong power cable and no display port cable
customer_reviews.text: The monitor seems like it does what is says it should do. But.... It comes with a European kettle lead, some random UK to power pack plug which doesn't fit anything else in the box and it only has a HDMI cable and not a display port cable. I'm going to buy a display port cable separately to check performance
customer_reviews.author: AJH

customer_reviews.title: Great monitorq
customer_reviews.text: For a budget 144Mhz monitor it is really clear. I get 144Mhz on Destiny 2 and it's buttery smooth. The colours and crispness is spot on too. Note: Doesn't come with a displayport cable for 144Mhz, but does come with a (very short) DVI which works.
customer_reviews.author: greg

customer_reviews.title: Great Screen
customer_reviews.text: Have been really happy with it so far. Please note the package does NOT come with a display port cable. It comes with DVI-D and my GTX2070 only has display port and hdmi so I had to wait for the cable to arrive too before I could use it
customer_reviews.author: Kuisis

customer_reviews.title: Blue pixel always on, can't unsee
customer_reviews.text: First and last time buying asus monitor. A blue pixel is permanently visible in any dark scenes. I know that RMA regulates for less than 3 pixels being "acceptable" but it's really not. Clearly a defective product which may or may not be indicative of defective manufacturing. In all my years using non-CRT monitors, this is the first I've had to endure pixel issues like this. Cannot recommend.
customer_reviews.author: E. Miller

customer_reviews.title: It has amazing quality and display port
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking to buy this or the benq the same price, buy this one 100%. It has amazing quality and display port, 144hz is amazing also. 4/5 because sound is not the best i use it to watch netflix at night and the only way to change the volume is going into the settings using the monitor as it does not come with a controller. If you cant reach 100+ fps in games I would maybe hold back on this purchase and upgrade your computer first.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This has been a return
customer_reviews.text: The monitor is great however the one I received has obviously been returned before. I can tell because the box has been resealed using tape and not very well tbh, It also has a 20mm scratch in the middle of the screen. I am keeping it because it's too much hassle to send it back. But please be aware it may not be brand new as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Johnmacdad

customer_reviews.title: Great if you need NVIDIA 3D Vision 2
customer_reviews.text: This is not one of those 4K HDR 165Hz monitors. However not many PC is capable to play 4K@120Hz every game out there. Many of us still play 1080p Gaming. And this monitor is really efficient for this purpose. Especially if you are looking for a 3D Monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Murat Öğüt

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Returned product with a full refund, colours all "washed out" despite calibrating with monitor buttons and pc adjustments!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: perfect ips screen
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -minimal light bleeding -fast IPS response and refresh rate -no dead pixel Cons: -expensive
customer_reviews.author: Apple Kun

customer_reviews.title: Best budget Moniter, no joke lol .. best one I've had which is cheap
customer_reviews.text: Headline says it all~ -Easy as hell installation, no need screwdrives etc; hand is enough -got some useful cables. Although, don't buy for it's speakers .. it does have speakers .. but it just makes sound .. poor quality xD so just get your own speaker or use a headphone.
customer_reviews.author: LawH

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic For The Price
customer_reviews.text: I didn't know what to expect from the reviews but a great monitor as I was upgrading my 60hz to a 144hz and was not disappointed. The picture quality is so much better too, highly recommend if you're upgrading your monitor or getting a new 144hz as I found it was one of the cheapest on the market. VERY PLEASED
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Ordered it on a Wednesday and got delivered Friday amazing delivery as it said two/three weeks
customer_reviews.text: Spent ages trying to find a gaming monitor, read so many reviews and articles, and this one seemed to be everyones top/second pick. Ordered it on a Wednesday and got delivered Friday amazing delivery as it said two/three weeks. Once I started it up, I then realised why its a little bit pricey is because it's superb. The games look fantastic on it, the 144hz makes everything look smooth and silky haha. So I'm glad I spent the extra £50/£60 on this monitor than a standard one. Can't go wrong with it. Good job Asus.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Not for me - I would advise to look elsewhere..
customer_reviews.text: This monitor was ok but I sent it back.. I wasn’t entirely happy overall especially for the price.. The monitor didn’t look that stylish and the quality of the panel wasn’t brilliant..
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Great value for money, I have tried other monitors by BenQ and LG, but up to now this has been the cheapest and best quality monitor I have had. Picture quality is excellent, it was easy to put together without the use of a screwdriver.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Mettam

customer_reviews.title: does not work  - avoid buying
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed that after 2 days of owning this rubbish it just doesn't work , spent money to get a no signal message when all (hdmi and dvi) are present . One should not buy a product that has clearly a fault and can't be enjoyed from the minute one has bought it. The amp fuse in the plug was also faulty as I checked all. thanks for wasting £200. Theft
customer_reviews.author: David Balchin

customer_reviews.title: amazing monitor, 144hz is almost essential for gaming on ...
customer_reviews.text: amazing monitor, 144hz is almost essential for gaming on pc, FYI to enable 144hz, you need to use a dp cable (at the time writing this consoles cannot support 144hz so I wouldn't recommend if buying for console. the 80,000,000:1 contrast ratio is superb, the texture of ther monitor is so smooth but wil catch dust and finger prints but is easy to clean. the monitor adjustment is perfect and easy to setup. FYI when u first use this monitor, it is set to 60hz, when you use your pc, set your monitor to 144hz, and make sure your game is set to 144hz.
customer_reviews.author: Rhyse

customer_reviews.title: Great value monitor
customer_reviews.text: Loving this monitor. There is a tiny bit of bleeding at the top, but only when the top is very dark and it's only noticeable if you are actively looking for it. It is a perfect size for gaming, the colours look great and the high refresh rate makes twitch based gaming far eaiser. In super hexagon, i completed a level i have never done so before first try!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew M.

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant monitor!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this monitor! Great picture and quality. Easy to use and responsive. A must for any gamer!!
customer_reviews.author: Poor Lou Lou

customer_reviews.title: great monitor
customer_reviews.text: Good picture quality and gaming speed. only negative was they sent a basic cable instead of display port to port one.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Amanda J. Steart

customer_reviews.title: Slight visual imperfection
customer_reviews.text: Nice monitor. My issue is, a bright dot on the screen, which draws your eyes to it. Looked on warranty information form and this seems to be an, acceptable imperfection to the manufactures. For the money, I would of liked it perfect.
customer_reviews.author: k

customer_reviews.title: Good monitor
customer_reviews.text: If your looking for something purely for gaming then this is great, I know there's better monitors now with 2x or 4x the amount of pixels, but for 1080p this is great, haven't bothered upgrading to anything better yet, don't see the point atm, probably will this year when the new Pascal graphics cards get released though 😊
customer_reviews.author: Einie D

customer_reviews.title: does what it says
customer_reviews.text: I brought this for my grandson for christmas ,so can only go by what he said which he said was great and loaded very quick
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.P.Mellor

customer_reviews.title: Great for gaming.
customer_reviews.text: This isnt a technical review I'm just writing this to say it is a fantastic monitor and I am looking at buying a second one. There is a really easy colour fix you can download online since the colours of the monitor straight out the box is poor. One issue I had, the cable I received with the monitor was faulty and causing green spots on my screen, luckily I had ordered a cable at the same time because I wasn't aware it came with one.
customer_reviews.author: Scott B

customer_reviews.title: Solid choice
customer_reviews.text: Colours are a bit off and it looks to gamery the bezels are pretty massive and the printed hdmi logo is the worst but outer than that’s its great
customer_reviews.author: Ross Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: Actually bought 2 of these monitors use them as my main gaming monitors very good picture but the one has developed a dead pixel, you cant see it unless your looking for it though
customer_reviews.author: Scott Thorne

customer_reviews.title: Using this in conjunction with my other Asus VS248HR which works out nicely. Wouldn't advise these monitors for a dual setup ...
customer_reviews.text: The difference between 60hz and 144hz is particularly noticeable! Using this in conjunction with my other Asus VS248HR which works out nicely. Wouldn't advise these monitors for a dual setup however as the bezel is quite big, but it'd probably be fine for the middle monitor of a tri-monitor setup. The stand was well made, however unless it was mounted differently as far as I can tell you wouldn't be able to have the screen portrait as it doesn't go up high enough for this.
customer_reviews.author: Jack F.

product_meta.title: ASUS VG248QE 24 Inch FHD (1920 x 1080) Gaming Monitor, 1 ms, Up to 144 Hz, DP, HDMI, DVI-D
product_meta.description:
Style Name:144 Hz| Size Name:24 InchASUS VG248QE 24 inch Widescreen LED Multimedia 3D Monitor (1920 x 1080, 80000000:1, 144 Hz, 1 ms, DVI Display Port, HDMI) - Black. UK Power Supply.

SAFETY WARNING
Do not open the physical casing of the product.

LEGAL DISCLAIMER
Euro Plug to UK Plug Adapter included if required

BOX CONTAINS
1x Asus VG248QE Monitor, Dual-link DVI cable, Audio cable, Power cord, Quick start guide, Support CD, Warranty Card

See more
feature_bullets: Highly smooth action with 144 Hz rapid refresh rate and 1 ms (GTG) response time
With an 80,000,000:1 ASUS Smart Contrast Ratio (ASCR) and 350 cd/m square of brightness, it delivers life-like visuals in Full HD 1920 x 1080
A comfortable viewing with ergonomic design for swivel, tilt, pivot and height adjustment
Featuring ASUS GamePlus function hotkey for comfortable gaming environment and experience
Signal Input : Support NVIDIA, Digital Signal Frequency : 30~140 KHz(H)
